title: Figure out mac/windows multiprocessing issues
body:
Getting errors w/ the multiprocessing in `DataGenerator` for windows builds on Python <3.8, and for Mac + Python >= 3.8.

```
AttributeError: Can't pickle local object 'DataGenerator.__iter__.<locals>.get_data'
```

Think it might be due to the switch from default process start method of "fork" to "spawn" modes, see [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60518386/error-with-module-multiprocessing-under-python3-8).  But that doesn't explain the windows issues...

[Example windows test failure](https://github.com/brendanhasz/probflow/runs/1547218554?check_suite_focus=true)

[Example mac test failure](https://github.com/brendanhasz/probflow/runs/1547098931?check_suite_focus=true)

Tried doing `multiprocessing.set_start_method("fork")` for mac + python 3.8, but then just got `RuntimeError: context has already been set` ([example](https://github.com/brendanhasz/probflow/runs/1547176343?check_suite_focus=true))...
